definition: to make a sound effect/sound effect/(historical linguistics) to reconstruct the sound system of an archaic language
to plan to/to draft (a plan)/to imitate/to assess/to compare/pseudo-
sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)

sentences.english: The onomatope issue of ancient Chinese is highly professional scholarship.
sentences.chinese: 古代漢語的擬音問題是一門很專業的學問。

sentences.english: The computerized voice, available in multiple languages, is hardly perfect.
sentences.chinese: 電腦擬音有多種語言可供選擇，但也並非完美無缺。

definition: to communicate by means of written notes (instead of speaking)/to publish one's opinion (e.g. as part of a scholarly dialogue)/(in book titles) essays/sketches
normally/as things should be/by rights/to reason things out/logic
to write a word incorrectly/typo/(medicine) to mistakenly transplant (an infected organ etc)
